post_info.post_title: Now what do you think about this?

What are you doing reading World Nut Daily, Doc?
Uh is the whole NAFTA/Amero deal still considered to be in the realm of conspiracy-nut alternate realities? I thought it was an established fact.

Uh is the whole NAFTA/Amero deal still considered to be in the realm of conspiracy-nut alternate realities? I thought it was an established fact.

 Facts don't stop the average person from staying in complete denial. Heck, even when former Mexican president Fox confirms the whole North American Union/Amero deal, the average Joe will still not accept it. The whole country could be crumbling down and the dollar could become so worthless that it won't even buy a glass of water and the sheeple will still loudly exclaim that America is the greatest country on the planet.
 
 As for the NAU/Amero, well it's coming and unless a major miracle happens like Ron Paul getting elected, it will be a reality in the near future. The US dollar has already reached parity with the Canadian dollar and is worth approximately 10 pesos, so the conversion into a new currency will be easy.
 The Trans Texas Corridor (i.e. the NAFTA Superhighway) is being built at a steady pace and pretty soon the US will be but a distant memory.
Are you kidding? There are too many patriotic crazies in the US for that to happen.

What are you doing reading World Nut Daily, Doc?
Just looking......;)

Just looking......;)

 
 I'm sure you found a lot to laugh about.;)

I'm sure you found a lot to laugh about.;)
Amazing stuff. . . . . .Amazing. I'm always impressed how part of the net has turned into the national inquirer with men from outer space and my cat swallowed a cow. . .you know!!

Amazing stuff. . . . . .Amazing. I'm always impressed how part of the net has turned into the national inquirer with men from outer space and my cat swallowed a cow. . .you know!!

 
 Also amazing that people actually quote these XXXXXX, and others as well.

http://www.wnd.com/news/article.asp?ARTICLE_ID=58091

 
 I think I'm not going to take any "news" site that is inudated by flashy, politically based ads all that seriously.

I think I'm not going to take any "news" site that is inudated by flashy, politically based ads all that seriously.

 
 For accurate information we need to look at European news sites.

Facts don't stop the average person from staying in complete denial. Heck, even when former Mexican president Fox confirms the whole North American Union/Amero deal, the average Joe will still not accept it. The whole country could be crumbling down and the dollar could become so worthless that it won't even buy a glass of water and the sheeple will still loudly exclaim that America is the greatest country on the planet.
 
 As for the NAU/Amero, well it's coming and unless a major miracle happens like Ron Paul getting elected, it will be a reality in the near future. The US dollar has already reached parity with the Canadian dollar and is worth approximately 10 pesos, so the conversion into a new currency will be easy.
 The Trans Texas Corridor (i.e. the NAFTA Superhighway) is being built at a steady pace and pretty soon the US will be but a distant memory.

 
 IMO the Amero will not be as easy to get as people seem to think. I, too, am surprised that anybody would consider the Amero a fringe lunatic tin foil hat type deal as well. When the presient of one of the countries confirms it, I think it kind of moves away from "conspiracy" to "fact".
 
 The problem is that they are going about it all backward. The current plan seems to be to get the latin American countries all using one currency and then the US will join, and then Canada. The problem there is that while it makes a great deal of sense for the US to switch to a common currency like that, it does not make as much sense for anybody to throw in with us. Lets say we do get all the latin american countries using a single currency. Do you really think they are going to be anxious for the US to come in with our trillions in debt and inasane amount of outstanding cash and sink their currency? I think not. There is simply no way at this point for any country to partner up with the US on a currency deal that would not screw the other country.
